(¬G → A1).natural: In the event that it is not the case that the project achieves conservation goals, then the project has adequate funding.

(¬G → A4).natural: Should it is not the case that the project achieves conservation goals, then the project causes harm to the ecosystem.

(¬G → A5).natural: Given that it is not the case that the project achieves conservation goals, then the project requires design modification.

(¬G → ¬A4).natural: If it is not the case that the project achieves conservation goals, then it is not the case that the project causes harm to the ecosystem.

A23.natural: The project qualifies for an environmental grant.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the project has adequate funding.

¬A10.natural: It is not the case that the project gets its application rejected.

¬A12.natural: It is not the case that the project increases tourism in the area.

¬A13.natural: It is not the case that the project improves habitat conditions.

¬A16.natural: It is not the case that the project faces community opposition.

¬A2.natural: It is not the case that the project has government approval.

¬A28.natural: It is not the case that the project finds significant issues.

¬A30.natural: It is not the case that the project gets fast-tracked for approval.

¬A38.natural: It is not the case that the project overcomes technical challenges.

¬A7.natural: It is not the case that the project passes committee review.
